properties.Name: Huron Hills Cross Country Ski Center
properties.Notes: Several short groomed trails, classic and skating. Frequently, there is skiable snow in the back bowl when the ground is bare everywhere else. Many people ski here after work - there are enough city lights to see where you're going in the dark.
properties.Google-address: Huron Hills Cross Country Ski Center, 3465 E. Huron River Dr., Ann Arbor, MI

properties.Name: Teton Lakes Golf Course
properties.Notes: A golf course that is privately groomed, low rolling hills, often icy.
properties.Google-address: 722 N 12th W, Rexburg, Idaho

properties.Name: Telluride
properties.Notes: None
properties.Google-address: Telluride, CO 81435, USA

properties.Name: Mt. Brighton
properties.Notes: Buy a rope tow pass, ski around the base of the slopes to warm up, then start climbing those hills. See if you can beat the chairlift up! Or get a group of people together & setup a slalom course (go up & down it).
properties.Google-address: Mt. Brighton, Brighton, MI

properties.Name: Love Creek County Park
properties.Notes: 10km total (4k skating, 10k classic), flat to rolling terrain. Grooming is fair (tracks) to good (skating). Grooming is done via snowmobile with track setter.
properties.Google-address: Love Creek County Park, 9228 Huckleberry Road, Berrien Center, MI

properties.Name: Allison-Chinook
properties.Notes: Trails: Allison-Chinook at the foot of Mount Tecumseh has 31 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing by the Crowsnest Pass Cross Country Ski Association. Most of the trails are rated Easy or Intermediate. The trails are mainly singletrack but there a few double track and skating sections.
properties.Google-address: Allison-Chinook, Coleman AB

properties.Name: Sandy McNabb
properties.Notes: Trails: About 37 km of trail are groomed for cross-country skiing in the Sandy McNabb/Sheep Valley Provincial Park section of Kananaskis Country.
properties.Google-address: Sandy McNabb, Turner Valley AB

properties.Name: West Bragg Creek
properties.Notes: Trails: In the Elbow Valley section of Kananaskis Country 45 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing.
properties.Google-address: West Bragg Creek, Bragg Creek AB

properties.Name: Hawk Ridge Centre
properties.Notes: Trails: Hawk Ridge Centre is no longer operating as a cross-country ski centre. The following info is no longer applicable. If the centre resumes operations please send us an e-mail.
properties.Google-address: Hawk Ridge Centre, Calgary AB

properties.Name: Canada Olympic Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Canada Olympic Park has a 2 km trail groomed for cross-country skiing (skate and classic) and lighted for night skiing. The Calgary Ski Club maintains trails at three golf courses around Calgary including 7 km of groomed trails at Shaganappi Golf Course.
properties.Google-address: Canada Olympic Park, Calgary AB

properties.Name: Banff townsite
properties.Notes: Trails: Three trails on the south side of the town of Banff have a combined total of 33 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing.Sundance trail (groomed rated Easy) runs 4 km along the Bow River then gently ascends to Sundance Canyon. It also connects to the Brewster Creek trail leading to Sundance Lodge.Spray River Loop (groomed rated Easy to Moderate) runs 12.5 km from Bow Falls along both sides of Spray River.The Goat Creek trail (groomed rated Moderate) continues from the far end of the Spray River Loop to a trailhead on Spray Lakes Road in Kananaskis Country. It's mainly uphill from Banff and a total distance of 19 km one way so its best to get dropped off on Spray Lake Road and ski to Banff if possible.There are also several backcountry trails including the Rundle Riverside trail extending 16 km to Canmore Nordic Centre.CAUTION: In backcountry areas there may be a possibility of avalanches check the park's avalanche bulletin before heading out and follow the proper avalanche safety guidelines.
properties.Google-address: Banff townsite, Banff AB

properties.Name: Sundance Trails
properties.Notes: Trails: Brewster Creek Trail is a 11 km linear trail that leads to the Sundance backcountry lodge. The groomed cross-country ski trail is rated Moderate. In addition there are about another 40 km of backcountry trails in the region.CAUTION: In backcountry areas there may be a possibility of avalanche check the park's avalanche bulletin before heading out and follow the proper avalanche safety guidelines.
properties.Google-address: Sundance Trails, Banff AB

properties.Name: Lake Minnewanka/Cascade
properties.Notes: Trails: A very popular trail in Banff National Park is the Cascade Trail at Lake Minnewanka which is a linear groomed trail (14 km each way). The trail is rated Easy and crosses the Cascade River near its midpoint.CAUTION: In backcountry areas there may be a possibility of avalanches check the park's avalanche bulletin before heading out and follow the proper avalanche safety guidelines.
properties.Google-address: Lake Minnewanka/Cascade, Banff AB

properties.Name: Castle Junction
properties.Notes: Trails: Near Castle Junction in Banff National Park there are several trails suitable for cross-country skiing two of which are groomed: the Castle Junction and Red Earth Creek trails (both rated Moderate). Castle Junction trail is 9 km one way. Red Earth Creek trail is 12 km one way. Shadow Lake Lodge (open weekends Feb-Mar) is another 3 km past the end of the groomed trail. There are also several backcountry trails.CAUTION: In backcountry areas there may be a possibility of avalanche check the park's avalanche bulletin before heading out and follow the proper avalanche safety guidelines.
properties.Google-address: Castle Junction, Banff AB

properties.Name: Baker Creek
properties.Notes: Trails: The Baker Creek region of Banff National Park has about 17 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing plus there are some backcountry trails.CAUTION: In backcountry areas there may be a possibility of avalanche check the park's avalanche bulletin before heading out and follow the proper avalanche safety guidelines.
properties.Google-address: Baker Creek, Lake Louise AB

properties.Name: Lake Louise
properties.Notes: Trails: In the Lake Louise region of Banff National Park more than 50 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing plus there are some backcountry trails. Trails link the lake and town of Lake Louise and extend north and south including one that goes 10 km to the Great Divide and Yoho National Park.On the east side of the highway the Pipestone network provides another 20 km of ski trails. Most of the groomed trails in the Lake Louise area are rated Novice Easy and Moderate. Approximately 20 km are groomed for both classic and skate.CAUTION: In backcountry areas there may be a possibility of avalanche check the park's avalanche bulletin before heading out and follow the proper avalanche safety guidelines.
properties.Google-address: Lake Louise, Lake Louise AB

properties.Name: Syncline
properties.Notes: Trails: Syncline Provincial Recreation Area offers 17 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing. Castle Mountain Resort located a few km south of Syncline also has a cross-country ski trail.
properties.Google-address: Syncline, Beaver Mines AB

properties.Name: Athabasca Falls
properties.Notes: Trails: On the Icefields Parkway in Jasper National Park 25 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing on unplowed roads making three linear trails: Whirlpool and Leach Lake both about 10 km and rated Easy/Moderate and Geraldinr Road 6 km Very Difficult.
properties.Google-address: Athabasca Falls, Jasper AB

properties.Name: Whistlers Campground
properties.Notes: Trails: South of the town of Jasper several trails are groomed for cross-country skiing:
properties.Google-address: Whistlers Campground, Jasper AB

properties.Name: Pyramid Lake Rd
properties.Notes: Trails: In Jasper National Park 17 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing at two locations near the town of Jasper:
properties.Google-address: Pyramid Lake Rd, Jasper AB

properties.Name: Jasper Park Lodge
properties.Notes: Trails: Near Jasper Park Lodge are several ungroomed trails suitable for cross-country skiing.
properties.Google-address: Jasper Park Lodge, Jasper AB

properties.Name: Maligne Road
properties.Notes: Trails: On Maligne Road there are several trails that are suitable for cross-country skiing at two separate areas: Summit Lakes and Maligne Lake. Summit Lakes is a 4 km groomed linear trail that is rated Easy.CAUTION: In backcountry areas there may be a possibility of avalanche check the park's avalanche bulletin before heading out and follow the proper avalanche safety guidelines.
properties.Google-address: Maligne Road, Jasper AB

properties.Name: Blue Lake Adventure Lodge
properties.Notes: Trails: William Switzer Provincial Park has about 15 km of trails that are occasionally groomed for cross-country skiing by snowmobile when conditions permit. The trails are near Blue Lake Centre an outdoor education centre and retreat formerly known as Blue Lake Adventure Lodge. It is separate from the Athabasca Lookout Centre in the south section of the park.
properties.Google-address: Blue Lake Adventure Lodge, Hinton AB

properties.Name: Athabathsca Lookout Nordic Centre
properties.Notes: Trails: The Athabasca Lookout Centre in William Switzer Provincial Park has 40 km of trails 28 km of which are groomed for cross-country skiing (skate and classic) by the Hinton Nordic Club. A 1.5 km trail is lighted for night skiing.Note that there is no on-site source of drinking water so bring your own.
properties.Google-address: Athabathsca Lookout Nordic Centre, Hinton AB

properties.Name: Pierre Grey's Lakes
properties.Notes: Trails: Pierre Grey's Lakes Provincial Park has 15 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing by the Smoky River Nordic Ski Club volunteers. There are also 9 km of backcountry trails in the park. The club also grooms trails in Grand Cache at Marv Moore Campground and the golf course.
properties.Google-address: Pierre Grey's Lakes, Grande Cache AB

properties.Name: Hornbeck Cross-Country Ski Centre
properties.Notes: Trails: At Hornbeck Creek Provincial Recreation Area 30 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing by the Muskeg Flyers Nordic Ski Club and the Alberta Forest Service.
properties.Google-address: Hornbeck Cross-Country Ski Centre, Edson AB

properties.Name: Pembina River Prov. Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Pembina River Prov. Park has 5 km of trails are available for cross-country skiing along the Pembina River valley.

properties.Name: Pembina Nordic Ski Club
properties.Notes: Trails: Near Drayton Valley 20 km of trails along the North Saskatchewan River are groomed for cross-country skiing (both skate and classic) by the Pembina Nordic Ski Club. Another 10 km of trails in the town of Drayton Valley are also groomed.
properties.Google-address: Pembina Nordic Ski Club, Drayton Valley AB

properties.Name: Beauvais Lake Provincial Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Beauvais Lake Provincial Park has 13 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing. Several trails lead to viewpoints.

properties.Name: Crimson Lake Prov. Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Crimson Lake Provincial Park has 10 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing plus there are also 10 km of backcountry trails.

properties.Google-address: Terratima Lodge, Rocky Mountain House AB

properties.Name: Bearberry Nordic Centre
properties.Notes: Trails: Bearberry Nordic offers 25 km of trails that are groomed for skate and classic cross-country skiing techniques on a working ranch.
properties.Google-address: Bearberry Nordic Centre, Bearberry AB

properties.Notes: Trails: 11 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing (skate and classic) at River Bend Golf Course. Waskasoo Park also has several trails at Great Chief Park Heritage Ranch and Red Deer College.

properties.Name: Pigeon Lake Prov. Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Pigeon Lake Provincial Park has 10 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing by a local club. There are also 8 km of trails at the nature conservancy near Rundle's Mission about 10 km north.

properties.Name: Jarvis Bay Prov. Park

properties.Notes: Trails: 18 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing by the St. Albert Nordic Ski Club. There are 2 km of trails lighted for night skiing on certain evenings.

properties.Name: Waterton Lakes National Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Two designated cross-country ski trails are located along the Akamina Parkway: the Dipper Trail (6 km return) and the Cameron Trail (5 km return). There are also several backcountry ski touring trails where there may be a possible avalanche hazard.
properties.Google-address: Waterton Lakes National Park, Waterton AB

properties.Name: Chickakoo Lake Recreation Area
properties.Notes: Trails: Chickakoo Lake Recreation Area offers 14 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing. There are lots of single track some double track some skating lanes. See the Edmonton Nordic Ski Guide for a more detailed description.
properties.Google-address: Chickakoo Lake Recreation Area, Stony Plain AB

properties.Name: River Valley Outdoor Centre
properties.Notes: Trails: Throughout Edmonton's River Valley 50 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing in nine different parks most of them by the city. Edmonton Nordic Ski Club grooms the trails at Gold bar Park where they operate snowmaking on the trails and offer ski lessons. There are also some ungroomed trails. Trails at three parks are lighted for night skiing.Terwillegar Park - 5 kmWhitemud Park - 3 kmWilliam Hawrelak Park - 3 kmVictoria Park - 3 kmKinsmen Park - 3.5 km lightedMill Creek Park - 5 kmRiverside Golf Course - 5 km + 5 km connector to Capilano Park - 8 km lightedGold Bar Park - 10 km lighted and snowmaking by ENSC
properties.Google-address: River Valley Outdoor Centre, Edmonton AB

properties.Name: Strathcona Wilderness
properties.Notes: Trails: Strathcona Wilderness is an outdoor adventure centre with 12 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing of which 7 km are groomed for skating technique. It serves as the base for the Strathcona Nordic Ski Club. For more information see the Edmonton Nordic Ski Guide.
properties.Google-address: Strathcona Wilderness, Sherwood Park AB

properties.Name: Strathcona Science Provincial Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Strathcona Science Provincial Park has 5 km of ungroomed trails that are available for cross-country skiing. Edmonton Nordic Ski Club operates a biathlon range in the park.
properties.Google-address: Strathcona Science Provincial Park, Sherwood Park AB

properties.Name: Cooking Lake-Blackfoot Prov. Rec. Area
properties.Notes: Trails: Cooking Lake-Blackfoot Provincial Recreation Area offers 65 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing including 32 km for skating. There are also 35 km of backcountry trails. Cooking Lake-Blackfoot PRA is the site of the annual Canadian Birkebeiner in February.Trails connect four staging areas: Waskehegan Blackfoot Islet and Central. Blackfoot trails are mainly groomed for skating technique. See the Edmonton Nordic Ski Guide for more description.
properties.Google-address: Cooking Lake-Blackfoot Prov. Rec. Area, Sherwood Park AB

properties.Name: Elk Island National Park

properties.Google-address: Elk Island National Park, Fort Saskatchewan AB

properties.Name: Miquelon Lake Prov. Park

properties.Google-address: Camrose Ski Club, Camrose AB

properties.Name: Vermilion Provincial Park

properties.Google-address: Vermilion Provincial Park, Vermilion AB

properties.Name: Whitney Lakes Prov. Park

There are two separate trail systems each with about 7 km of trails: Spring Creek and Spruce Coulee. Spring Creek trails are rated Easy Spruce Coulee are intermediate to expert.
properties.Google-address: Cypress Hills Provincial Park, Elkwater AB

properties.Name: Cold Lake Provincial Park

properties.Google-address: Tawatinaw (Westlock Ski Club), Tawatinaw AB

properties.Name: Muskeg Creek Ski Trails
properties.Notes: Trails: At Muskeg Creek 10 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing including some that are groomed for skating. A 1.5 km trail is lighted for night skiing. The centre is the site of the Athabasca Loppet in late January.
properties.Google-address: Muskeg Creek Ski Trails, Athabasca AB

properties.Name: Thunder Lake Prov. Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Thunder Lake Provincial Park has 12 km of trails available for cross-country skiing.
properties.Google-address: Thunder Lake Prov. Park, Barrhead AB

properties.Name: Carson-Pegasus Provincial Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Carson-Pegasus Provincial Park offers 6 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing. There are also some ski trails in Whitecourt.

properties.Name: Swan Hills Cross-Country Trails
properties.Notes: Trails: Swan Hills 8 km of trails maybe available for cross-country skiing.Note: This information may be out of date and no recent data is available. If you have any recent info about this destination please send us an e-mail.

Caution: Check avalanche reports and carry avalanche rescue equipment

properties.Name: Grizzly Ridge

properties.Notes: Trails: Winagami Lake Provincial Park offers 18 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing.

properties.Notes: Trails: O'Brien Prov. Park offers 12 km of ungroomed trails for cross-country skiing.

properties.Notes: Trails: Wapiti Nordic Ski Club grooms 35 km of trails for cross-country skiing. A 4.5 km trail is lighted for night skiing. The centre was the site of the 1995 Canada Winter Games.
properties.Google-address: Wapiti Nordic Ski Club, Grande Prairie AB

properties.Name: Saskatoon Island Prov. Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Saskatoon Island Prov. Park's 6 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing.

properties.Name: Moonshine Provincial Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Moonshine Provincial Park's 20 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing.

properties.Notes: Trails: About 32 km of trails are groomed intermittently for cross-country skiing in the Smith-Dorrien section of Kananaskis Country. Trails are rated mostly intermediate to expert.

properties.Name: Fort McMurray Trails
properties.Notes: Trails: In Fort McMurray the 20-km Birchwood Trail system is groomed by the Ptarmigan Nordic Ski Club. The trails were the site of the 2004 Artic Winter Games and they host the annual Ptarmigan Loppet. Gregoire Lake Provincial Park south of town has 10 km of ungroomed trails.
properties.Google-address: Fort McMurray Trails, Fort McMurray AB

properties.Name: Peter Lougheed Provincial Park
properties.Notes: Trails: 85 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiers of all levels of ability in the Peter Lougheed Provincial Park section of Kananaskis Country.
properties.Google-address: Peter Lougheed Provincial Park, Canmore AB

properties.Name: Ribbon Creek
properties.Notes: Trails: Approximately 60 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing near the Nikiska Ski area in the Kananaskis Village/Ribbon Creek section of Kananaskis Country.
properties.Google-address: Ribbon Creek, Kananaskis Village AB

properties.Name: Kitimat XC Ski Club
properties.Notes: Trails: At Onion Lake the Snow Valley Nordic Ski Club grooms 25 km of trails by snowcat for cross-country skiing. They light 5 km of trails for night skiing and allow dogs on one of the trails. The club hosts the annual Snow Valley Marathon in February.
properties.Google-address: Kitimat XC Ski Club, Kitimat BC

properties.Name: Cariboo Ski Touring Club
properties.Notes: Trails: The Cariboo Ski Touring Club grooms 10 km of trails for cross-country skiing at Ten Mile Lake plus another 20 km at Hallis Lake including a 2.5 km lighted loop. The club hosts the Hallis Lake Loppet in January.
properties.Google-address: Cariboo Ski Touring Club, Quesnel BC

properties.Name: Williams Lake XC Ski Club
properties.Notes: Trails: At Bull Mountain near Williams Lake 28 km of trails are groomed by snowcat for cross-country skiing (skate and classic) by the Williams Lake Cross Country Ski Club. Two loops totalling 3.5 km trail are lighted for night skiing.
properties.Google-address: Williams Lake XC Ski Club, Williams Lake BC

properties.Name: 108 Resort (Best Western)
properties.Notes: Trails: At 108 Mile Ranch 56 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing including a lighted loop for night skiing. The trails connect with the Hills Snow Park and are part of a 150-km community network.
properties.Google-address: 108 Resort (Best Western), 108 Mile Ranch BC

properties.Name: Hills Health & Guest Ranch
properties.Notes: Trails: The Hills Snow Park offers 20 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing by the resort. A Snowcat groomer and snaowmaking equipment help ensure the best possible ski conditions. The Hills trails connect with the 108 Mile Ranch network and are part of a 150-km community network around 100 Mile House.
properties.Google-address: Hills Health & Guest Ranch, 108 Mile Ranch BC

properties.Name: One Hundred Mile Nordic Ski Society
properties.Notes: Trails: One Hundred Mile Nordic Ski Society grooms 50 km of trails for cross-country skiing at the 99 Mile Ski centre. The centre has 5 km of trails lighted for night skiing and features racing loops of 2.5 3.5 5 7.5 10 and 20 km and a stadium.A trail links the 99 Mile trail system with the Red Coach Trails. The trails are part of the 150-km network around 100 Mile House and are the site of the annual Cariboo Ski Marathon.
properties.Google-address: One Hundred Mile Nordic Ski Society, 100 Mile House BC

properties.Name: Red Coach Inn
properties.Notes: Trails: The Red Coach Inn offers 11 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing and is part of the 150-km community network around 100 Mile House. The trails connect with the 99 Mile Ski Trails
properties.Google-address: Red Coach Inn, 100 Mile House BC

properties.Name: Clinton Snow Jockey Club
properties.Notes: Trails: Approximately 30 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing by the Clinton Snow Jockey Club plus there are also 25 km of backcountry trails. The trails are above 1100 metres in elevation so there is usually more snow than at lower elevations.
properties.Google-address: Clinton Snow Jockey Club, Clinton BC

properties.Name: Big Bar Guest Ranch
properties.Notes: Trails: Big Bar Guest Ranch offers ungroomed trails for Guests Only
properties.Google-address: Big Bar Guest Ranch, Clinton BC

properties.Name: Tyax Mountain Lake Resort
properties.Notes: Trails: At Tyax Mountain Lake Resort 17 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing plus there are also 20 km of backcountry trails.Note: This information may be out of date. There is no winter activities mentioned on the resort's website so it may no longer be open in winter.
properties.Google-address: Tyax Mountain Lake Resort, Gold Bridge BC

properties.Name: Bulkley Valley XC Ski Club
properties.Notes: Trails: The Bulkley Valley Cross Country Ski Club grooms 45 km of trails for cross-country skiing with a snowcat groomer for both classic and skating techniques. The centre has 5.5 km of trails lighted for evening skiing. There are trails for all levels of challenge--from easy to advanced. Due to its location the centre has a long ski season (up to 6 months).
properties.Google-address: Bulkley Valley XC Ski Club, Smithers BC

properties.Name: Whistler Ski Trails
properties.Notes: Trails: In the town of Whistler 32 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing (classic and skate) in Lost Lake Park and on two golf courses. Four km of trails are lighted for night skiing. Many other areas nearby are suitable for backcountry touring and telemarking but check the avalanche conditions before setting out.Two other nearby ski areas are Callaghan Country and the Whistler Olympic Park site of the nordic ski events for the 2010 Olympic Winter Games.
properties.Google-address: Whistler Ski Trails, Whistler BC

properties.Name: Callaghan Country
properties.Notes: Trails: Callaghan Country is a luxurious full-service backcountry lodge with 40 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing. The trails connect with those of the Whistler Olympic Park site of the nordic events for the 2010 Olympic Winter Games. Day skiers can purchase a combined pass good for both trail systems which together offer a total of more than 90 km of trails.Callaghan Country has lots of singletrack trails and some double track and skating. There are some difficult sections of trails lots of intermediate sections and some easy sections.The surrounding Coast Mountain Range provides lots of opportunities for backcountry touring and telemarking. Guided backcountry trips can be arranged through the lodge.CAUTION: Anyone planning on backcountry trips should be knowledgeable and experienced in backcountry travel and avalanche safety.
properties.Google-address: Callaghan Country, Whistler BC

properties.Name: Whistler Olympic Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Whistler Olympic Park the venue for the 2010 Olympic nordic competitions offers 55 km of groomed trails. The park's trails connect with those of Callaghan Country and together they offer a total of more than 90 km of groomed trails.The competition trails for cross-country skiing and biathlon together with additional recreational trails provide 11 beginner trails 12 intermediate and four expert trails. Six km of trails are lighted for night skiing one evening a week and there are 5 km of rollerski trails during the summer.The Whistler Olympic Park operates from mid-November to mid-April when snow conditions permit. Before planning your trip check the park's event calendar to see if the trails will be closed for an event. BC's largest loppet the P'ayakentsut is held here in February.
properties.Google-address: Whistler Olympic Park, Whistler BC

properties.Name: Mt Washington Resort
properties.Notes: Trails: Mount Washington Resort has 55 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing (classic and skating). The trails are at the 900 metre elevation so receive about 30 feet of snow annually. A few of the trails can be accessed by chairlift.A few of the resort's trails are lighted for skiing on Thursday to Saturday evenings. properties.Name: Norman Wells Cross Country Ski Club
properties.Notes: Trails: 25 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing with various levels of difficulty. There are also about 15 km of backcountry trails.Remarks by the club president (2004): Most of the trails are marked but we are still improving them so expect the unexpected. A wolf fox wolverine or some two legged creature may have knock over a sign but look for the ski tracks.We live and play in an isolated remote northern Canadian wilderness region (Latitude 65 degrees) where common sense must prevail. Limited sun light cold weather and sudden changes in weather are extreme hazards. When you travel the ski trails connecting multi-use trails and back country make sure to let someone know where exactly you are headed and your expected time of return. There are no patrols of the ski trails multi-use trails or back country so if you get yourself into trouble you are on your own!

properties.Name: Les Sentiers du Moulin
properties.Notes: Trails: At Les Sentiers du Moulin 38 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing including 10 km for skating technique. Trails link with those of Le Refuge.
properties.Google-address: Les Sentiers du Moulin, Lac Beauport QC

properties.Name: Le Refuge
properties.Notes: Trails: 46 km* of trails are groomed for cross-country skiings including 9 km for skating. The trails are linked with those of Sentiers de Moulin a return trip of about 50 km between trailheads.*Length with no overlap. The length of trails is sometimes given as more than 100 km but that figure was calculated by including overlapping sections of trail more than once.
properties.Google-address: Le Refuge, Saint-Adolphe-de-Stoneham QC

properties.Name: Club Mont-Torbillon
properties.Notes: Trails: Mont-Torbillon appears to no longer groom their trails for cross-country skiing but there are 12 km of snowshoeing trails.
properties.Google-address: Club Mont-Torbillon, Lac Beauport QC

properties.Name: Parc du Mont-Sainte-Anne
properties.Notes: Trails: Mont-Sainte-Anne is Quebec's largest cross-country ski resort with approximately 105 km* of trails groomed for cross-country skiing including 60 km of skating trails. A 65-km backcountry trail connects with Camp Mercier.*Length with no overlap. The length is sometimes given as 210 km but that figure was calculated by including overlapping sections of trail more than once.
properties.Google-address: Parc du Mont-Sainte-Anne, St-Ferreol-les-neiges QC

properties.Name: Sentiers des Caps de Charlevoix
properties.Notes: Trails: Sentier des Caps de Charlevoix offers 32 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing. The centre is at an elevation of 800 metres so enjoys a long ski season. There is also a 50-km linear backcountry trail overlooking the St Lawrence River connecting several huts. Baggage transport and car transfer services are available.
properties.Google-address: Sentiers des Caps de Charlevoix, Saint-Tite-des-Caps QC

properties.Name: Camp Mercier
properties.Notes: Trails: Camp Mercier offers 52 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing including about 12 km for skating. One trail connects with those of Forat Montmorency. A 65-km backcountry trail connects with Mont-Sainte-Anne and has two huts along its path. Another two backcounry networks in nearby Parc de la Jacques-Cartier have six huts along the trails. This area generally has the best snowfall in the southern half of the province.
properties.Google-address: Camp Mercier, Quebec City QC

properties.Name: Club de ski de fond Ferme-Neuve
properties.Notes: Trails: Montagne du Diable near Ferme-Neuve offers about 70 km of trails for cross-country skiing of which 30 km are groomed for classic and skating. Most of the trails are rated Intermediate and Difficult.

properties.Name: Le Genevrier
properties.Notes: Trails: Le Genevrier outdoor centre offers 12 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing.
properties.Google-address: Le Genevrier, Baie-Saint-Paul QC

properties.Name: Mont Grand-Fonds
properties.Notes: Trails: Mont Grand-Fonds has about 69 km* of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing including about 15 km for skating technique. Snowfall averages about 650 cm (over 20 feet) per year so the ski season is long.*Length with no overlap. The length is often publicized as more than 100 km but that figure was calculated by including overlapping sections of trail more than once.
properties.Google-address: Mont Grand-Fonds, La Malbaie QC

properties.Name: Les Sources Joyeuses de la Malbaie
properties.Notes: Trails: Les Sources Joyeuses outdoor centre offers 35 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing including 6 km for skating. The centre is operated by a not-for-profit organization with the aid of the municipality. It is situated in the Charlevoix meteor crater the seventh largest in the world.
properties.Google-address: Les Sources Joyeuses de la Malbaie, La Malbaie QC

properties.Google-address: Chibougamau, Chibougamau QC

properties.Name: Centre de plein air St-Nazaire
properties.Notes: Trails: Base de plein air St-Nazaire reportedly has 28 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing.Note: This information may be out of date and there is no new data available. If you have any recent info about this destination please send us an e-mail.
properties.Google-address: Centre de plein air St-Nazaire, St-Nazaire QC

properties.Name: Club de ski de fond de Mt Valin
properties.Notes: Trails: At Parc des Monts-Valin 20 km of trails are groomed for classic and skating. There are another 50 km backcountry trails including one to the Vallee des Fantomes (heavily-snowed trees that look like ghosts) with a snowcat shuttle service available. Hut-to-hut trips are possible. This region usually has one of the longest ski seasons in Quebec. Groomed trails are open Friday to Sunday.
properties.Google-address: Club de ski de fond de Mt Valin, Saint-David-de-Falardeau QC

properties.Name: Nakkertok Ski Club
properties.Notes: Trails: Nakkertok Ski Club grooms 80 km of trails for cross-country skiing by snowcat of which 2 km are lighted for night skiing. The trails are located in two separate areas North and South connected by a 24 km backcountry trail. With over 1000 members the centre is very popular with capital region families. The club hosts the annual Nakkerloppet and other races.

properties.Name: Parc du Saguenay
properties.Notes: Trails: The Saguenay provincial park offers 30 km of challenging backcountry ski trails in Les Caps sector. Les Murailles sector consisting of Lac Emmuraille Mont Edouard Lac Tout-Nu and Lac Cardinal have 100 km of ungroomed ski trails and are operated by a local organization.Note: La Montagne Blanche Sector is prone to avalanches and is extremely dangerous so access is prohibited in winter.

properties.Name: Sentier de la riviere Amedee
properties.Notes: Trails: At Sentier de la riviere Amedee 32 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing by a local ski club. The trails consist of lots of easy and intermediate sections and a few difficult sections. Most of the trails are single-track classic but several are groomed for skating. On weekends the trails are patrolled by volunteers.
properties.Google-address: Sentier de la riviere Amedee, Baie-Comeau QC

properties.Name: Sentier Nor-Fond
properties.Notes: Trails: About 33 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing by the Club de Ski Norfond. A 4-km trail is lighted for night skiing.

properties.Name: Chateau Montebello
properties.Notes: Trails: At Chateau Montebello there are 27 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing on the grounds of the luxurious resort. A 15 km trail extends north into the Kenauk Reserve In February the Chateau is the focal point of the Canadian Ski Marathon a two-day 160 km ski tour from Lachute to Buckingham.

properties.Name: Saint-Jovite
properties.Notes: Trails: Approximately 45 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing (including some with skating lanes) wend their way around the Mont-Tremblant resort and south towards the town of Saint-Jovite. Several backcountry trails traverse the region.Trails at Domaine St Bernard are situated in a more natural setting than the other trails through the town and resort. Roughly half the trails are rated Easy 40% Difficult and 10% Most Difficult.
properties.Google-address: Saint-Jovite, St-Jovite QC

properties.Name: Parc du Mont Tremblant
properties.Notes: Trails: In the western sector of Parc du Mont Tremblant (La Diable) near Lac Monroe 55 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing including 13 km for skating technique. There are also a network of backcountry trails that connect with Pimbina in the eastern sector of the park. Backcountry huts are available for rent from the park.Six trails are rated Easy two Intermediate and three Difficult. New in 2012: a 13 km loop connects to the Chutes-Croches waterfall.
properties.Google-address: Parc du Mont Tremblant, Lac-Superieur QC

properties.Name: Base de plein air Le Petit Bonheur
properties.Notes: Trails: At Le P'tit Bonheur outdoor recreation centre 45 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing. The trails are open to the public on weekends only.
properties.Google-address: Base de plein air Le Petit Bonheur, Lac-Superieur QC

properties.Name: Parc des campeurs
properties.Notes: Trails: At Parc des campeurs 45 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing (classic only). A trail connects with Saint-Adolphe 15 km to the south.
properties.Google-address: Parc des campeurs, Sainte-Agathe QC

properties.Name: Centre de ski de fond l'Estrel
properties.Notes: Trails: Near the town of Esterel 35 km of cross-country ski trails are groomed for both classic and skating. Of the 10 groomed trails three are rated Easy three Intermediate and four Difficult. Most of the trails are uni-directional so be sure to ski in the direction indicated. There are also some trails for backcountry skiing. In 2009 operation of the trails changed from Esterel resort to Hors Limite Inc. and the center moved to its present location.
properties.Google-address: Centre de ski de fond l'Estrel, Esterel QC

properties.Name: Parc du Mont-Tremblant
properties.Notes: Trails: The east sector of Parc du Mont-Tremblant (La Pimbina) offers about 50 km of ungroomed trails for cross-country skiing. The park's backcountry trails connect with La Diable (#24) in the western sector of the park to offer a total of more than 100 km of ski touring. Several backcountry huts are available for rent from the park.
properties.Google-address: Parc du Mont-Tremblant, Saint-Donat QC

properties.Name: La Reserve/Saint-Donat

properties.Name: Forat Ouareau
properties.Notes: Trails: Foret Ouareau offers 29 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing. Another 26 km of backcountry skiing on the Sentier National (National Trail) traversing several peaks is best suited to snowshoeing.
properties.Google-address: Forat Ouareau, Notre-Dame-de-la-Merci QC

properties.Name: Club de ski de fond d'Evian
properties.Notes: Trails: About 30 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing by the Club de ski de fond d'Evain. A new chalet was opened in 2007. Six trails are rated Easy four Difficult and three Very Difficult.

properties.Name: Base de plein air l'Interval
properties.Notes: Trails: L'Interval outdoor centre offers 30 km of backcountry trails including a trail up Mt Kaikop one of the highest peaks in the region. A 10 km trail is groomed for cross-country skiing.
properties.Google-address: Base de plein air l'Interval, Sainte-Lucie-des-Larentides QC

properties.Name: Centre de Ski de Fond Val-David
properties.Notes: Trails: Val-David and Far Hills have a combined total of 63 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing including 12 km for skating. The trails connect with the P'tit Train du Nord linear park. There are also several backcountry trails one of which was blazed by the legendary Jackrabbit Johannsen.In 2005 a land dispute involving trails in the Val-David and Val-Morin region resulted in the creation of the 500-hectare Parc Dufresne encompassing many of the Far Hills and Val-David trails.
properties.Google-address: Centre de Ski de Fond Val-David, Val-David QC

properties.Name: Centre de plein air Sainte-Adele
properties.Notes: Trails: At Sainte-Adele more than 40 km of of trails are available for cross-country skiing in two different locations: Mont-Rolland to the south and Loup Garou to the north near Chantecler. Most of the south trails are rated Very Difficult. Five groomed trails in the north sector provide 20 km of Intermdiate skiing.
properties.Google-address: Centre de plein air Sainte-Adele, Sainte-Adele QC

properties.Name: St-Adolphe-d'Howard
properties.Notes: Trails: At St-Adolphe-d'Howard 30 km of trails are groomed for classic technique. Another 50 km of backcountry trails are located around the town. A trail connects with Parc des Campeurs 15 km to the north. An ungroomed trail links with the Morin Heights backcountry trails. Most of the trails are rated intermediate to advanced.
properties.Google-address: St-Adolphe-d'Howard, St-Adolphe-d'Howard QC

properties.Name: Viking Ski Club
properties.Notes: Trails: Viking Ski Club grooms 50 km of trails for cross-country skiing including 10 km of racing trails with a lane for skating. Two sections of the trail are rated Easy two are Difficult and one is Most Difficult but most trails have both hilly and flat sections. The Viking trail system connects with those of Morin Heights. The club hosts the Morin-Heights Viking Loppet in late February.
properties.Google-address: Viking Ski Club, Morin-Heights QC

properties.Name: Morin Heights
properties.Notes: Trails: The cross-country ski centre operated by the municipality of Morin-Heights offers 60 km of groomed trails plus there is also many backcountry trails. Two trails are rated Easy ten are Difficult and ten Most Difficult. Except for the Aerobic Corridor the trails are single-track with a recommended direction of travel.The groomed Norin Heights trails connect with those of the Viking Club. Backcountry trails connect with Saint-Adolphe 10 km north.
properties.Google-address: Morin Heights, Morin-Heights QC

properties.Notes: Trails: Brownsburg's Centre de ski de fond La Randonnee groom 24 km of trails for cross-country skiing (classic only) all rated Intermediate. The centre is open Wednesday to Sunday.
properties.Google-address: Centre de ski de fond La Randonnee, Brownsburg QC

properties.Name: Lac Carling
properties.Notes: Trails: About 20 km of trails are available for cross-country skiing at the five-star Lac Carling resort.
properties.Google-address: Lac Carling, Pine Hill QC

properties.Name: Club de Montagne d'Argenteuil
properties.Notes: Trails: Closed in 1999--no longer operates
properties.Google-address: Club de Montagne d'Argenteuil, Calumet QC

properties.Name: Centre de ski de fond Gai-Luron
properties.Notes: Trails: Centre de ski de fond Gai Luron grooms 24 km of trails for cross-country skiing (classic technique). Four km of trails are rated Beginner 8 km are Intermediate and 12 km are Expert.
properties.Google-address: Centre de ski de fond Gai-Luron, Saint-Jerome QC

properties.Name: Club de ski de fond Mt Rolland
properties.Notes: Trails: Mont-Rolland has several backcountry trails that are part of the Sainte-Adele network and connect to the P'tit Train du Nord linear park.

properties.Notes: Trails: The 45 km section of the P'tit Train du Nord rail trail from Saint-Jerome to Val-David is groomed for cross-country skiing (classic and skating technique). North of Val-David the trail is for snowmobiling only. The linear park links up with trails at the Riviere-du-Nord regional park Sainte-Adele and Val-David/Far-Hills. The trail rises gradually from St-Jerome to Val-David. Due to its even surface the trail does not require much snow to be skiable so has generally a longer ski season than the other nearby centres.
properties.Google-address: Parc lineaire le P'tit Train du Nord, Val-David QC

properties.Name: Club de ski de fond de Granada
properties.Notes: Trails: About 16 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing by the Granada ski club. Trails range from easy to intermediate.

properties.Name: Parc regional de la Riviere-du-Nord
properties.Notes: Trails: At the Parc regional de la Riviere-du-Nord there are 25 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing including 5 km for skating technique. Most of the trails are rated Easy or Intermediate. The trails connect with the P'tit Train du Nord linear park.
properties.Google-address: Parc regional de la Riviere-du-Nord, Saint-Jerome QC

properties.Name: Parc du Domaine Vert
properties.Notes: Trails: Parc du Domaine Vert offers 25 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing including 5 km for skating technique.
properties.Google-address: Parc du Domaine Vert, Mirabel QC

properties.Name: Parc d'Oka
properties.Notes: Trails: Parc d'Oka grooms 47 km of trails for cross-country skiing including 23 km for skating technique. Trails consist of easy lakeside loops and more challenging hillside trails. Twenty-seven km of trails are rated Easy 7 km are More Difficult and 16 km Most Difficult.A viewpoint at the top of the Calvaire hill overlooks Lac des Deux Montagnes. Seven stucco structures situated at the viewpoint and along the Calvaire trail house religious frescoes. A 4 km trail is lighted for night skiing on certain evenings.
properties.Google-address: Parc d'Oka, Oka QC

properties.Name: Centre de plein air des Cedres
properties.Notes: Trails: The Base de plein air des Cadres offers 12 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing (skate and classic). Night skiing is offered twice a week.

properties.Name: L'Escapade Linear Park
properties.Notes: Trails: L'Escapde Linear Park in Rigaud has 25 km of cross-country ski trails through predominantly maple forest groomed by the city of Rigaud. The trails consist of three long loops with a few linear offshoots. Situated on Mont Rigaud half the trails are rated Difficult. From the upper trails there a viewpoints overlooking the St Lawrence valley and the Adirondacks.

properties.Name: Parc du Cap St Jacques
properties.Notes: Trails: Cap St Jacques Nature Park offers 15 km of easy trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing by the city of Montreal.

properties.Name: Parc regional du Bois-d'Ile-Bizard
properties.Notes: Trails: The Bois-d'Ile-Bizard Nature Park offers 18 km of mostly flat trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing.
properties.Google-address: Parc regional u Bois-d'Ile-Bizard, Montreal QC

properties.Name: Parc regional du Bois-de-Liesse
properties.Notes: Trails: Bois-de-Liesse Nature Park offers about 22 km of mostly flat trails groomed for cross-country skiing by the city of Montreal.

properties.Name: Parc du Mont-Royal

The summit trails are the most challenging on the island best suited to intermediate skiers. Other Montreal city parks that have easy ski trails include Maisonneuve and Angrignon parks with about 10 km each.

properties.Notes: Trails: Mont Saint-Bruno provincial park grooms 35 km of trails for cross-country skiing of which 8 km include a skating lane. Three trails are rated Easy four are Difficult and one is Very Difficult. The trails are open several evenings a week for night skiing with a headlamp.

properties.Notes: Trails: Weyburn's trails are not groomed for cross-country skiing but skiers make their own tracks at the Souris Valley grounds and Jubilee Park.Note: This information may be out of date and no recent data is available. If you have any recent info about this destination please send us an e-mail.
properties.Google-address: Weyburn Cross-Country Ski Trails, Weyburn SK

properties.Name: Moose Mountain Provincial Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Moose Mountain Provincial Park offers 55 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing for both classic and skate skiing. Most of the trails are in the Little Kenosee Trail System west of the riding academy. Several trails are also at the golf course. There are three Easy trails totalling 10 km four Intermediate (28 km) and four Expert (20 km). A 3 km lighted trail in Fish Creek Campground is groomed for classic and skate skiing.
properties.Google-address: Moose Mountain Provincial Park, Kenosee SK

properties.Name: Carlton Trail Regional Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Carlton Trail Regional Park has 6 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing the by Carlton Trail Ski Club.
properties.Google-address: Carlton Trail Regional Park, Langenburg SK

properties.Name: Echo Valley Provincial Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Echo Valley Provincial Park has 10 km of trails that are groomed for cross-country skiing. There are two Easy trails (4 km) one Intermediate (5 km) and one Expert (1.2 km).
properties.Google-address: Echo Valley Provincial Park, Fort Qu'Appelle SK

properties.Name: Kluane National Park
properties.Notes: Trails: Several trails are groomed for cross-country skiing each located in a different area of the park. Some of the longer trails are suitable for backpacking ski tours.Along with two neighbouring parks Kluane is designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Topping out at 6050 metres Mount Logan Canada's highest peak is located in the interior of the park surrounded by glaciers. Access to the glaciers is usually accomplished by aircraft and is advised only for those with proper glacier safety training.
properties.Google-address: Kluane National Park, Haines Junction YT

properties.Name: Whitehorse Cross Country Ski Club
properties.Notes: Trails: At Mount McIntyre there are 60 km of trails groomed for cross-country skiing by the Whitehorse Cross Country Ski Club plus there are also some backcountry trails. A 5-km trail is lighted for night skiing on weeknights. There are some single track some double track lots of skating lane. Trail ratings: some difficult sections lots of intermediate sections some easy sections. Trails are patrolled. The centre hosts the Yukon Loppet in early March and was the site of the cross-country events of the 2007 Canada Winter Games.There are also 10 km of trails at Log Cabin on the road to Skagway which are often groomed by the Skagway Ski Club and are the site of the annual Buckwheat Classic.
properties.Google-address: Whitehorse Cross Country Ski Club, Whitehorse YT

properties.Name: Gray Mountain Biathlon Trails
properties.Notes: Trails: 45 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing including a 1 km lighted trail. There are also some backcountry trails. The centre was the site of the biathlon events of the 2007 Canada Winter Games.Note: This information may be out of date and there is no new data available. If you have any recent info about this destination please send us an e-mail.
properties.Google-address: Gray Mountain Biathlon Trails, Whitehorse YT

properties.Name: Carcross Community Ski Club
properties.Notes: Trails: The slopes of Montana Montain are an excellent location for snowshoeing and backcountry skiing from mid-November until late April.
properties.Google-address: Carcross Community Ski Club, Carcross YT

properties.Name: Marsh Lake Trails
properties.Notes: Trails: 20 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing. The centre hosts the annual Marsh Lake Loppet in February.Note: This information may be out of date and there is no new data available. If you have any recent info about this destination please send us an e-mail.
properties.Google-address: Marsh Lake Trails, Marsh Lake YT

properties.Name: Aitlin Ski Club Trails
properties.Notes: Trails: About 10 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing by the Atlin Ski Club.
properties.Google-address: Aitlin Ski Club Trails, Atlin BC

properties.Name: Dawson City Jackrabbit Cross Country Ski Club
properties.Notes: Trails: 7 km of trails are groomed for cross-country skiing.Note: This information may be out of date and there is no new data available. If you have any recent info about this destination please send us an e-mail.
properties.Google-address: Dawson City Jackrabbit Cross Country Ski Club, Dawson City YT

properties.Name: Chestnut Valley
properties.Notes: Michigan Cup race site. The trail is groomed by Nubs nob and connects to Nubs Nob's trail system. The trails (at least during the last race there) were groomed wide enough that 2 skaters could ski side by side.
properties.Google-address: Chestnut Valley, Harbor Springs, MI

properties.Name: Pine Haven Recreation Area
properties.Notes: One of the Midland County Parks, Pine Haven is located in the woods along US10 near Sanford. Take the West River Road exit from US10 and follow the signs to the park. Trails (about 15K) are sometimes groomed (more reliably for classic). The upper-level beginner's loop is very flat, while several intermediate and advanced loops descend from the plateau to two small streams. No rentals or food, but there is a porta-john and often a ski patrol on weekends. No lighted trails.
properties.Google-address: Pine Haven Recreation Area , Midland, MI

properties.Name: Addison Oaks
properties.Notes: Addison Oaks is another Oakland County park north of Rochester that usually is groomed for both skating and classic. Last year (2001-2002) they didn't groom at all. I think because of lack of snow but it might have been budgetary. Addison has a great trail network, quite a bit of single track in the woods and a lot along open farm fields but in the shadow of tree lines to preserve snow. It's the same course they run Mt. Bike races on in the spring and fall (race coming up Sept. 15, 2002) I'll find out what the situation with grooming is there and let you know what they'll have this year. (By Michael Bliss)
properties.Google-address: Addison Oaks, 1480 West Romeo Road, Lake Orion, MI

properties.Name: Independence Oaks
properties.Notes: 10 minutes north of Pontiac, S.E. Michigan's best kept secret. Independence Oaks, an Oakland County Park, is accessible from I-75. Take exit 89, Sashabaw rd. North 3 miles entrance on your left. This park gets snow when everywhere else gets just a dusting. 6-8 week season plus, up to 3 months of skiing. Park maintenance grooms for skating and lays a track for classic. Warming hut and old classic rentals. Vending machines. Closes at dark. $5.00/day pass (Oakland Country residents, $8 everyone else), $20.00 for annual. Awesome hilly trails make you feel like your up north. You'll not believe your an hour from Detroit. Park service people though enthusiastic are not knowledgeable about trail conditions. They'll tell you no skiing when it's great back in the woods. (By Michael Bliss)
properties.Google-address: Independence Oaks, 9501 Sashabaw Road, Pontiac, MI

properties.Name: Pigeon Creek
properties.Notes: 16 K of groomed x-c ski trails with diagonal skating lanes, 2 K of lighted x-c ski trails, sledding hill, x-c ski rentals and warming lodge.
properties.Google-address: Pigeon Creek, Holland, MI

properties.Name: Crystal Mountain
properties.Notes: 40K groomed classic and skating. Site of several Michigan Cup races.
properties.Google-address: Crystal Mountain, 12500 Crystal Mountain Dr, Cadillac, MI

properties.Name: Proud Lake State Park
properties.Notes: Tracked (classic) skiing in the winter. Very flat. Warmup house.
properties.Google-address: Proud Lake State Park, Pontiac, MI

properties.Name: Dune's Golf Course
properties.Notes: The Dune's Golf Course is near Empire, Mi. It's the desperation course for me when there isn't enough snow to go out on the normal areas around here. Quite a few skiers use this area throughout the winter. It has 18 fairways with nice rolling terrain. The grass they have planted there allows the snow to sit on top and it lasts pretty long even when it gets over 32f. We have been bugging the owner to groom a loop trail with no luck...so far. -Kevin Kelly.
properties.Google-address: Dune's Golf Course, 6464 W. Empire Hwy (M-72), Empire, MI

properties.Name: Forbush Corner
properties.Notes: 38K groomed skating & classic. A wide variety of terrain. Many trail changes this year.
properties.Google-address: Forbush Corner, Frederic, MI

properties.Name: Garland
properties.Notes: 40k groomed skating & classic. Michigan Cup race site.
properties.Google-address: Garland, Lewiston, MI

properties.Name: Lewiston
properties.Notes: None
properties.Google-address: Lewiston, MI

properties.Name: Hanson Hills
properties.Notes: 35 km of wooded rolling terrain Groomed 14' wide with set track to accommodate classical & skating styles. Michigan Cup race site.
properties.Google-address: Hanson Hills, Grayling, MI

properties.Name: Lakes of the North
properties.Notes: 20K of nordic ski trails??
properties.Google-address: Lakes of the North, Grayling, MI

properties.Name: McGuire's Resort
properties.Notes: 10K of groomed trails (3K lighted for night skiing).
properties.Google-address: McGuire's Resort, 7880 Mackinaw Trail, Cadillac, MI 49601

properties.Name: Hudson Mills Metropark
properties.Notes: Snow and grooming can be poor. Classic only. Warm Cross Country Ski Center.
properties.Google-address: Hudson Mills Metropark, Ann Arbor, MI

properties.Name: Indian Springs Metropark
properties.Notes: Ten miles of groomed cross country ski trails, but snow and grooming can be poor.
properties.Google-address: Indian Springs Metropark, Pontiac, MI

properties.Name: Kensington Metropark
properties.Notes: Cross Country Ski Touring Center (Golf Course) with marked trails, rental equipment and food bar, but snow and grooming (classic only) can be poor. Some of the best trails overlap with the horse trails, and the horses can take out all the grooming.

properties.Name: Stony Creek Metropark
properties.Notes: Cross Country Ski Touring Center (Golf Course) has marked trails, rental equipment and weekend food service
properties.Google-address: Stony Creek Metropark, Pontiac, MI

properties.Name: Maybury State Park
properties.Notes: Used to do ski rental, but no longer. Groomed for classic only. Good combination of easy flat trails where you can ski 2-3 abreast or jump into the woods where others have skied. Very scenic. 17K of ski trails.
properties.Google-address: Maybury State Park, Northville, MI

properties.Name: Muskegon Winter Sports Complex
properties.Notes:
There are two artificially lighted cross country ski trails with lengths of 2.5 kilometers and 5.0 kilometers respectively; a 3.5 kilometer expert trail; and, a 4.0 kilometer "natural classical" only trail.Trails are groomed daily for both classical and skate skiing. 
 
 The trail winds through dense forests dominated by white pines which have often referred to as the "enchanted forest" after a snowfall. The "quiet" skier often encounters local wildlife, such as whitetail deer, ruffled grouse, squirrel, or the growing population of wild turkey.
properties.Google-address: Muskegon Winter Sports Complex, 462 Scenic Drive, Muskegon, MI 49445

properties.Name: Otsego Ski Club/Hidden Valley Resort
properties.Notes: 10K of groomed trails. Michigan Cup Race Site
properties.Google-address: Otsego Ski Club/Hidden Valley Resort, Gaylord, MI

properties.Name: Rikert Nordic Center
properties.Notes:
From their homepage: "55+ km of skate and classic skiing, snowshoeing and fat biking nestled in the heart of the Green Mountain National Forest.
 Our trails lead through wonderful forests, old farm fields edged by stonewalls, along babbling brooks, and even past Robert Frosts Summer Cabin. Youll quickly understand the inspiration this area has offered to so many.
 The Nordic Center is fully ADA accessible, offers a full service rental shop, and a PSIA certified ski school. Relax and refuel by the warm wood stove, enjoy the great food, warm beverages and a cozy atmosphere."
properties.Google-address: 106 College Cross Road, Barn East, Ripton, Vermont

properties.Name: Shanty Creek
properties.Notes: 30K. Excellent grooming, even midweek! Good place to skate or classic.
properties.Google-address: Shanty Creek , One Shanty Creek Road, Bellaire, MI 49615

properties.Name: Old Mill State Park
properties.Notes: None
properties.Google-address: 33817 Co Hwy 128, Argyle, MN 56713, USA

properties.Name: Detroit Mountain Ski Trails
properties.Notes: Trails flow around the base of Detroit Mountain downhill area.
properties.Google-address: Detroit Mountain Rd, Detroit Lakes, MN 56501, USA

properties.Name: Fort Snelling State Park
properties.Notes: The most popular trail is the Pike Island loop offering views of the confluence of the Mississippi and Minnesota Rivers.
properties.Google-address: 5459 Snelling Lake Rd, St Paul, MN 55111, USA

properties.Name: Phalen Golf Course
properties.Notes: Most of the trails are on the golf course thus pretty open and fairly flat. The course really winds back and forth.
properties.Google-address: 1400 Phalen Dr, St Paul, MN 55106, USA

properties.Name: Highland 9-hole Golf Course
properties.Notes: Rated beginner to intermediate.
properties.Google-address: 1820 Edgcumbe Rd, St Paul, MN 55116, USA

properties.Name: Grass Lake
properties.Notes: Part of the Vadnais-Snail Lakes Park these trails have both wooded and marsh land characteristics. Easy to intermediate level of difficulty.
properties.Google-address: 485 Gramsie Rd, Shoreview, MN 55126, USA

properties.Name: Tamarack Nature Center
properties.Notes: Ski through beautiful prairie woodland and marsh with abundant wildlife. 1km practice loop. Easy to intermediate level of difficulty. Visitor center with ski rental.
properties.Google-address: 5300 Otter Lake Rd, White Bear Lake, MN 55110, USA

properties.Name: Como Golf Course
properties.Notes: Trails are on the golf course. Some nice hills but most of the course is pretty exposed. There is one back leg that is quite shaded and seems to hold snow long after the rest of the course loses it. Rentals at the chalet.
properties.Google-address: 1398 Lexington Pkwy N, St Paul, MN 55103, USA

properties.Name: Pine Lake Ski Trails
properties.Notes: Located in the Tamarac National Wildlife Refuge.
properties.Google-address: Co Hwy 29, Rochert, MN 56578, USA

properties.Name: Frontenac State Park
properties.Notes: Trails rated easy to challenging.
properties.Google-address: 34661 County 2 Blvd, Frontenac, MN 55026, USA

properties.Name: Nerstrand-Big Woods State Park
properties.Notes: All 6 miles of trail run through the Big Woods Landscape with portions along Prairie Creek and Hidden Falls waterfall. Park manager recommends skiers walk the short portion of difficult terrain down Hidden Falls Trail to access the intermediate to easy rolling terrain.

properties.Name: Sibley State Park
properties.Notes: Intermediate to challenging trails with lots of ups and downs. Double tracked predominantly one-way loop trails. Skate ski from park office to Mt. Tom for a spectacular winter panoramic view of the area.
properties.Google-address: 398 Co Hwy 48, New London, MN 56273, USA

properties.Name: Flandrau State Park
properties.Notes: The park maintains 8 miles of groomed cross-country ski trail. Cross-country skiers enjoy the flat trails on the bottom of the valley or more challenging routes on the oak-shaded bluffs.
properties.Google-address: 1313 Summit Ave, New Ulm, MN 56073, USA

properties.Name: Forestville/Mystery Cave State Park
properties.Notes: 11 miles of cross-country ski trails of which 8.5 miles are groomed. More than 60 miles of ski trail are available near the park on the Root River Trail System. Primarily intermediate skill level. Grooming is usually done on Fridays for the weekend.
properties.Google-address: County Rd 118, Preston, MN 55965, USA

properties.Name: Mississippi National Ski Trails
properties.Notes: 8KM groomed for classic 7KM groomed for both classic and skating. The classic loop is one through wooded terrain and offers extensive views of the Mississippi River. The trailhead is located at the Mississippi National Golf Course Parking lot 2 miles south of Red Wing. Also known as Red Wing East End Recreational Area.
properties.Google-address: 28326 US-61, Red Wing, MN 55066, USA

properties.Name: Chester Woods Park
properties.Notes: This is a county park that contains 1300 acres. They groom about 5 miles of trails. The park is both wooded and hilly and the trails are well marked with maps at most intersections.
properties.Google-address: 8920 US-14, Eyota, MN 55934, USA

properties.Name: Eastwood Golf Course
properties.Notes: The main training course in Rochester. Usually groomed regularly it can get a bit hardpacked between snowfalls.
properties.Google-address: Towne Club Pkwy SE, Rochester, MN 55904, USA

properties.Name: Soldier's Field Golf Course
properties.Notes: Nice quiet trails right in the city on the golf course. With the city light you can see the trails fairly well at night.
properties.Google-address: 244 Soldiers Field Dr SW, Rochester, MN 55902, USA

properties.Name: Great River Bluffs State Park
properties.Notes: Trails rated easy to moderate.
properties.Google-address: Kipp Dr, Winona, MN 55987, USA

properties.Name: Lindenwood Park Ski Trails
properties.Notes: A flat trail that follows the Red River of the North along its floodplain. 10km groomed for classical 4km for skating.
properties.Google-address: 203 22nd Ave S, Moorhead, MN 56560, USA

properties.Name: Saint Mary's University
properties.Notes: Some of the best trails in southern Minnesota. Tucked in the valley behind the school the trails run around the northern slopes of the valley making them quite challenging and also well protected from the sun. Some lighted sections and snowmaking operations.
properties.Google-address: 740 Terrace Heights, Winona, MN 55987, USA

properties.Name: Balsam Branch Trails
properties.Notes: The Balsam Branch trails are open to the public for no charge. When there is snow tracks are set by Polk County Park and volunteers. The trailhead parking area is always well plowed. Toilet facilities are available at the nearby Kennedy Environmental center but no coffee shop or warming facility. Roughly 4K of lighted trails added in 2010.
properties.Google-address: 1392 120th Ave, Amery, WI 54001, USA

properties.Name: Ashland Ski Trail
properties.Notes: A beautiful trail right in the city of Ashland. The full 6.3 kilometers of the trail are tracked for classic style skiing and most are groomed for skate style skiing as well.
properties.Google-address: 1635 Maple Ln, Ashland, WI 54806, USA

properties.Name: Mt. Ashwabay Ski Trails
properties.Notes: A great mix of beginner and expert ski trails. With the inclusion of the Jerry Jolly Trails there is about 25 km groomed for skating and classic. There is also an additional 15 km of classic only trails. With views of Lake Superior and the Apostle Islands this is a very scenic area to ski. There is a nice lodge which sells snacks and food as well as a ski patrol and small downhill area.
properties.Google-address: 32515 Ski Hill Rd, Bayfield, WI 54814, USA

properties.Name: Blue Hills Trail
properties.Notes: A 32K network of well-signed trails coursing through heavily wooded hills and valleys. Timely grooming for both skating and striding. Heated log warming house toilets and ample parking.
properties.Google-address: Fire Lane Rd, Weyerhaeuser, WI 54895, USA

properties.Name: After Hours Ski Trail
properties.Notes: Mostly easy to moderate with a few challenging hills. Best known for good grooming and scenic views of the Brule River. Groomed for both classic and skating. Home to the River View Loppet Race in March.
properties.Google-address: 5750 Afterhours Rd, Brule, WI 54820, USA

properties.Name: Telemark Resort Trails
properties.Notes: Some of the most famous trails in the area! The American Birkie starts here and the Korteloppet makes extensive use of the trail system.
properties.Google-address: Telemark Rd, Cable, WI 54821, USA

properties.Name: Anvil National Recreation Trail
properties.Notes: Forested terrain varies from mostly level (West Trail East Trail) to rolling hills (Ninemile Trail Lake Loop) to hilly (Devil's Run). Chickadees waiting to eat birdseed from your hand at the warming shelter. Toilets are available at the parking area and warming shelter.
properties.Google-address: 2511 WI-70, Eagle River, WI 54521, USA

properties.Name: Nicolet North Trail
properties.Notes: Forested terrain varies from nearly level (Ash Meadow Camp 22) to mostly rolling (Roller Coaster Run The Gulch Pat Shay Trail Narrow Gauge Loop) to several scattered hills. This trail connects with the Anvil National Recreation Trail.
properties.Google-address: Fournier Rd, Three Lakes, WI 54562, USA

properties.Name: Nordmarka Ski Trails
properties.Notes: This trail is maintained by the Nordmarka Ski Club of Eagle River.
properties.Google-address: 504 McKinley Blvd, Eagle River, WI 54521, USA

properties.Name: Edgewood Golf Course Ski Trail
properties.Notes: Classical trails wind through this golf course situated on the floodplain of the Red River of the North. Also 5K of skating trails.
properties.Google-address: 3790 Aspyn Ln N, Fargo, ND 58102, USA

properties.Name: Lake Forest Recreation Area
properties.Notes: Part of the Lake Forest Recreation Area Golf Course.
properties.Google-address: 3612 Eagle Waters Rd, Eagle River, WI 54521, USA

properties.Name: Tower Ridge Ski Area
properties.Notes: Great trails--hills and flats--for all levels. Groomed for both classical and skating. There are about 3km of lighted trails.
properties.Google-address: 641 Co Rd L, Eau Claire, WI 54703, USA

properties.Name: Birkie Trail
properties.Notes: The famous Birkie trail. A great rolling trail through the woods between Cable and Hayward. There is a short section south at Hwy OO that is lighted. There are snowmaking trails at the Start area.
properties.Google-address: 12205 County OO, Hayward, WI 54843, USA

properties.Name: Willow River State Park
properties.Notes: Trails range from easy such as the Purple Trail running along the Willow River to the challenging Brown and Silver trails. Trails are groomed for both classical and skate skiing. All grooming is done by volunteer groomers who pride themselves in providing the best possible conditions.
properties.Google-address: 1034 Co Hwy A, Hudson, WI 54016, USA

properties.Name: Hixon Forest
properties.Notes: The trails are groomed by the City of La Crosse Park Department after each snowfall. They are groomed for skate-skiing and classic skiing.
properties.Google-address: Unnamed Road, La Crosse, WI 54601, USA

properties.Name: Hoffman Hills
properties.Notes: Challenging trails located 10 miles NE of Menomonie.
properties.Google-address: 730th St, Menomonie, WI 54751, USA

properties.Name: Red Cedar River Trail
properties.Notes: A groomed stretch from Menomonie to Downsville. Red Cedar Outfitters offer return van rides for a one-way ski trip. Follow direction signs from I-94.
properties.Google-address: 912 Brickyard Road,, Menomonie, WI 54751, USA

properties.Name: Mecca
properties.Notes: Trails are on rolling glacial terrain through pine spruce and tamarack forests. A heated chalet with a vault toilet wax bench and changing room is located at the Cabin trailhead. There is a second trailhead at the Little Turtle Flowage parking lot.
properties.Google-address: 4686N Fierick Rd, Mercer, WI 54547, USA

properties.Name: Minocqua Winter Park Nordic Center
properties.Notes: PistenBully groomed trails (with 12 km groomed for classic-only) 2 km lighted and 15km of power-tilled single-track ski trails. Glaciated terrain provides for a wide range of beginner to expert level trails and a telemark slope. On-site amenities include a chalet with PSIA certified ski school and& ski shop food service and a heated waxing room.
properties.Google-address: 12372 Scotchman Lake Rd, Minocqua, WI 54548, USA

properties.Name: Montreal Trails
properties.Notes: 2km railroad grade makes for great cruising. Other steeper plunges down to the grade. Trails are in the city of Montreal just west of Ironwood/Hurley. Densely wooded and secluded. Donation box. Connects with 19km Uller trail to Whitecap Mtn which is even more remote.
properties.Google-address: 6 Bessemer St, Montreal, WI 54550, USA

properties.Name: Levis/Trow Mound Trail
properties.Notes: The trail system consists of approximately fifteen miles of groomed trail and another ten of ungroomed backcountry routes. The more advanced trails are located north and west of Levis on Trow Mound while intermediate and easy trails lay near the base of Levis Mound. All groomed trails are set with diagonal tracks and a skating lane averaging 12 feet wide. Depending on snow conditions the trail is generally groomed twice per week. Trail passes are required. Facilities include a new cross-country ski chalet running water mens and womens bathrooms.
properties.Google-address: WI-95, Neillsville, WI 54456, USA

properties.Name: Afterglow Lake Resort
properties.Notes: Afterglow Ski Trails are groomed for skate and classic 5-7 times a week with a Tidd Tech G2. The full width groomed trails are protected by a thick mixed hardwood forest with trees right to the trails edge. A large heated warm up room is perfect to wait for the diehards in your group. UP snowbelt for reliable snow.
properties.Google-address: 4945 Sugar Maple Rd, Phelps, WI 54554, USA

properties.Name: Timberland Hills
properties.Notes: A great trail system! Nice wide trails and many challenging sections.
properties.Google-address: 1832 Boyd Ln, Barronett, WI 54813, USA

properties.Name: Timberland Hills West
properties.Notes: Right next door to the famous Timberland Hills trails this is a short section that is lighted until around 11 pm.
properties.Google-address: 2993 3rd St, Barronett, WI 54813, USA

properties.Name: Razorback Ridges Trail
properties.Notes: Mixed forest and open field terrain varies from nearly level to mostly hilly with several scattered hills. All 18 trail segments are groomed and only 2 segments groomed exclusively for classical. McKay's Corner Store located at the trailhead offers warming shelter food and beverages.
properties.Google-address: 3110 Razorback Rd, Sayner, WI 54560, USA

properties.Name: Plover River Ski Trail
properties.Notes: Mostly wooded terrain along segments of Plover River. Warming shelter open on weekends. Located off Hwy 66 east of Stevens Point past the airport; turn right at Plover River Trail sign.
properties.Google-address: 5294 Airport Rd, Stevens Point, WI 54482, USA

properties.Name: Superior Municipal Forest
properties.Notes: Trails groomed for classical and skate skiing. Trail fee required.
properties.Google-address: 3509 N 28th St, Superior, WI 54880, USA

properties.Name: Nine Mile County Forest Recreation Area
properties.Notes: One of the top trails in NE Wisconsin. Trails are generally one-way and double-tracked (skate and classic). The ski chalet offers a changing area ski and snowshoe equipment rentals daily and annual trail passes and restrooms. There roughly 6K of lighted trails and programmed to go on at dusk until 9 pm. Trail difficulty ranges from beginner to difficult.
properties.Google-address: 221700 Red Bud Rd, Wausau, WI 54401, USA

properties.Name: Hiram Ski Trail
properties.Notes: Another set of trails within the Foot Hills State Forest these are rated from novice to expert.
properties.Google-address: 6405 Lower 10 Mile Lake Rd NW, Hackensack, MN 56452, USA

properties.Name: Sylvan Hill Park
properties.Notes: Rated beginner to intermediate. The trails are hilly and wooded and meander through Sylvan Hill Park. Parking is available in the Sylvan Chalet parking lot.
properties.Google-address: 1001 N 10th St, Wausau, WI 54403, USA

properties.Name: Greenwood Hills Trail
properties.Notes: This trail is located on hilly terrain just east of the Wausau City limits on Greenwood Hills Golf Course. This golf course skiing provides challenging climbs and exhilarating downhills. The trail includes wooded sections.
properties.Google-address: 2002 Poplar Ln, Wausau, WI 54403, USA

properties.Name: ABR
properties.Notes: ABR is a full service touring center located on scenic and varied terrain along the Montreal River in Ironwood Michigan. Trailhead cabin retail ski shop rentals and lessons available. They have state of the art grooming equipment including Pisten Bully powertillers and groom daily. Open at 9 AM daily from November to April 1st.
properties.Google-address: N8934 S Range Rd, Ironwood, MI 49938, USA

properties.Name: Swedetown Trails
properties.Notes: Beginner to expert trails. 4.5k lighted until 10 p.m. Host to the annual Great Bear Chase. Up down turns mixed stands of forest and clearings provide an exciting terrain for the skier. The flow of the trail is Swedetown's specialty. The trail is meticulously groomed and the addition of a warming chalet and lighted trail have made Swedetown hard to beat.
properties.Google-address: 25196 Bridge St, Calumet, MI 49913, USA

properties.Name: Chassell Trail
properties.Notes: Easy to intermediate level. The hills have been designed to provide ample landing space at the bottom with no surprise corners. 1km lighted trail. Maintained through cooperation from private landholders and The Chassell Recreation Club on a volunteer basis. Parking and the trailhead at the Chassell Heritage Center.
properties.Google-address: 42403 Wilson Memorial Dr, Chassell, MI 49916, USA

properties.Name: Copper Harbor Pathway
properties.Notes: Trails vary from easy to expert including the Kamakazie 9 km Intermediate to Expert loop.
properties.Google-address: Fanny Hoe Creek, Mohawk, MI 49950, USA

properties.Name: Maasto Hiihto Ski Trails
properties.Notes: The trail is located in the city of Hancock and can be accessed from many points. The main trailhead is located at the Houghton County Arena. Easy to expert trails pass a picnic spot and beautiful vistas.
properties.Google-address: 1500 Birch St, Hancock, MI 49930, USA

properties.Name: Michigan Tech University Ski Trails
properties.Notes: Long downhills gathering speed and sharp turns at the bottom are distinctive of the trails you will find here. 34k of groomed trails 24k of skate trails 7k lighted trails in the evening until 9pm. Trails are groomed daily to manage the 200"+ of annual snowfall. Heated chalets at the Main Trailhead and Nara Trailhead.
properties.Google-address: Core loop, Houghton, MI 49931, USA

properties.Name: Deep Portage Ski Trails
properties.Notes: Located in the Deep Portage Conservation Reserve the trails are rated novice to expert.
properties.Google-address: 2197 Nature Center Dr NW, Hackensack, MN 56452, USA

properties.Name: Hill Street Classic Trails
properties.Notes: Trails range from easy to difficult. Part of the Superior Nordic Training and Recreation Area. Located directly west of Suicide Bowl Trails.
properties.Google-address: 258 Hill St, Ishpeming, MI 49849, USA

properties.Name: National Mine Ski Area
properties.Notes: Just west of Ishpeming these trails also have a biathlon range.

properties.Name: Porcupine Mountains Wilderness State Park

properties.Name: Lake Bronson State Park

properties.Name: Three Island Park

This hilly lake-strewn and partially wooded countryside is an excellent setting for x-country skiing. Most trails are fairly level and easy to ski.

properties.Name: Pine Beach Trail

properties.Name: Northland Arboretum

properties.Name: French Rapids Ski Trails

properties.Name: Crow Wing State Park

properties.Name: Lake Carlos State Park

properties.Name: Cleary Lake Regional Park

properties.Name: Montebello Trail

properties.Notes: The 4.2 miles of trails loop through trees wetlands prairies and past granite quarries and rock remnants. Trails are rated Easy and Intermediate. Parts of the trails are groomed for skate skiing along with the classic. Check out the four miles of lighted trails.

properties.Name: Mississippi River County Park
properties.Notes: The 3.5 miles of trails loop through pines and hardwood forest and offer beautiful views of the Mississippi River. The trails are rated as easy.
properties.Google-address: 41300 Co Rd 1, Rice, MN 56367, USA

properties.Name: Rock Lake

properties.Notes: Mostly intermediate level trails are groomed for classical or both classic and skating. There is also a beginner loop. Skating sections tend to be quite narrow and the trail is remote and heavily wooded. Ideal classical terrain.

properties.Notes: The terrain is gentle and winds through the woods along the lake bog and nearby Manitowish River. There is also a warming/changing room with free hot apple cider and cookies. Trails are maintained by volunteers at the Discovery Center.

Ridge Norway Pine and Wildcat trails have very steep sections and are recommended for experts.

properties.Name: Lake Maria State Park
properties.Notes: Beginner to intermediate skill level primarily intermediate. Rolling terrain goes through wooded areas old growth forest areas and past lakes and ponds.

properties.Name: Montissippi Park

properties.Name: Eagle Lake Regional Park

properties.Google-address: 10840 57th Ave N, Minneapolis, MN 55442, USA

properties.Name: East River Valley Park/Carr's Woods
properties.Notes: Nearly level trail through densely wooded flood plain. This trail is one of the best in Iowa because of the protection afforded by the dense tree cover. Trail is groomed for classic and skating on Fridays by local enthusiasts.

properties.Name: Sister's Farm
properties.Notes: Growing from a few classical trails this area now includes a fine skate trail that parallels the Flambeau River. Classical trails on west side skate east side.
properties.Google-address: 4058-4360 Sisters Farm Rd, Ladysmith, WI 54848

The trail winds along College Creek in the wooded ISU Arboretuem and out into open fields. It has moderately rolling terrain with several challenging hills. The trail has very good turf cover but unfortunately is not groomed regularly. Usually there is a classic track established by local use. Skating can be great on this trail if the snow conditions are right.
properties.Google-address: Ames, IA

properties.Name: Ellis Park

properties.Google-address: Zika Ave NW, Cedar Rapids, IA 52405

properties.Name: Cedar Valley Trail
properties.Notes: The trail is a multi-use trail for biking hiking and cross-country skiing.
properties.Google-address: 508 Lime St, Brandon, IA 52210, USA

properties.Name: Blackwater Environmental Area

properties.Name: Sugarbush Trail System

Trailheads include Britton Peak and Moose Fence on the western side with ski-throughs connecting these sections to the Onion River Rd/Oberg Mountain trails and trailhead on the eastern edge.

There is not a warming shack but at least one port-o-potty at the main parking lot. Primarily groomed for skate (not always tracked for classic).

properties.Name: St. Croix Bluffs Regional Park

Trails are mostly easy to intermediate with a few challenging hills.

properties.Name: Big Aspen Recreation Area

properties.Name: Reforestation Camp

properties.Google-address: 4100 Reforestation Rd, Suamico, WI 54313, USA

properties.Name: Mines of Spain Recreation Area

properties.Name: Spirit Mountain
properties.Notes: Beautifully wooded cross-country ski trails double tracked with skating lanes and groomed daily.

properties.Name: Barkhausen Waterfowl Preserve
properties.Notes: Fairly flat terrain through forests meadows and wetlands.
properties.Google-address: 2024 Lakeview Dr, Suamico, WI 54313, USA

properties.Name: Hartley Park
properties.Notes: Trails vary from easy to advanced.
properties.Google-address: 2032 Hartley Rd, Duluth, MN 55803, USA

properties.Name: Whitnall Park
